tasks.task: Diagnose and treat fig tree non-fruiting issues
subtasks: Differentiate between common perceived causes and actual cause of fig trees not fruiting
Explain the role of plant hormones in fruiting
Address summer pruning techniques for encouraging fig tree fruiting
Discuss winter pruning methods for fig trees and their impact on hormone balance
Recommend proper pruning techniques for encouraging fig tree fruit set

tasks.task: Communicate via video/blogging platform to address viewer concerns
subtasks: Interact with viewers through messages and comments
Provide resources such as blog posts or companion guides for in-depth information
Check tree's hormone balance (virtual inspection)
Determine correct pruning technique (planning)
Remove excess枝条 (physically pruning)
Protect tree from winter damage (application of mulch or wrapping)

tasks.task: Determine the cause of fig tree non-fruiting and implement solutions
subtasks: Evaluate fig tree's current pruning methods
Identify proper pruning techniques (thinning vs. heading cuts)
Conduct pruning on fig tree in autumn/winter
Protect fig tree from winter cold to prevent damage

tasks.task: Prune fig tree to encourage fruiting.
Perform winter pruning on a fig tree to correct hormonal balance
subtasks: Choose appropriate branches for removal
Use pruning shears to make clean cuts
Remove up to half of new growth
Gather pruning tools (pruning shears, maybe loppers)
Examine tree branches for selection
Make precise cuts to remove up to half of the new growth (heading vs. thinning)

tasks.task: But the key idea here is that the task of fixing the non-fruiting is achieved through pruning. So I think "Prune fig trees for increased fruiting" is the MAINTASK, with subtasks as above.

subtasks: Inspect tree for structural issues (heading cuts in previous years)
Toggle problematic branches (identify the ones that need removal)
Apply pruning to promote fruiting (remove up to half the new growth)

tasks.task: Prune fig trees to enhance fruiting potential
Perform proper pruning to achieve hormonal balance in a fig tree
subtasks: Determine appropriate timing (winter)
Select the correct pruning technique (thinning vs. heading)
Execute precise cuts on fig tree branches to the desired extent (1/3 to 1/2 new growth)
Identify the injury-prone areas (from heading cuts or winter damage)
Apply thinning cuts to balance hormonal growth

tasks.task: **MAINTASK**: Diagnose and treat fig tree non-fruiting issues
subtasks: Differentiate between common misconceptions (e.g., lack of water) and the actual cause (hormone imbalance)
Explain the role of plant hormones in fruiting
Address summer pruning techniques for encouraging fruiting (e.g., removing a third to half of new growth)
Discuss winter pruning methods (e.g., thinning cuts vs. heading cuts) and their impact on hormone balance
Recommend proper pruning techniques (e.g., thinning trunks at the base) to enhance fruit set

tasks.task: Communicate via video/blogging platform to address viewer concerns
subtasks: Interact with viewers through messages and comments
Provide resources such as blog posts or companion guides for in-depth information
